body:
That looks like a bug in Hubic, but it is easy enough to work around.

Any chance you could send me the output of `-vv --dump-bodies` for the transaction that produced the error?  Run your command again with `-vv --dump-bodies` should do it.

```
$ rclone  -vv --dump-bodies ls hubic:/
2017/06/08 21:54:29 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--dump-bodies" "ls" "hubic:/"]
2017/06/08 21:54:29 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2017/06/08 21:54:29 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc4201c7000)

Authorization: XXXX
Accept-Encoding: gzip
```

Thanks for posting that.

I've realised that the problem isn't with hubic, it is with your remote string.

You can't copy files to `/` on a hubic remote - you need a name of a bucket first.

So if you do `rclone -vvvv copy b hubic:b`

It should work fine.

The actual error message is crazy though, and I've fixed that here

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-170-g2ca477c5/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It will now give the error `Failed to copy: container name needed in remote`

$ rclone -V rclone v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β ``` $ rclone -vvvv --dump-bodies ls hubic:foo 2017/06/11 10:21:58 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vvvv" "--dump-bodies" "ls" "hubic:foo"] 2017/06/11 10:21:58 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 2017/06/11 10:21:58 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc420181800) 2017/06/11 10:21:58 DEBUG : GET /1.0/account/credentials HTTP/1.1 Host: api.hubic.com User-Agent: rclone/v1.36-170-g2ca477c5β Authorization: XXXX Accept-Encoding: gzip 2017/06/11 10:21:58 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 2017/06/11 10:21:59 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< 2017/06/11 10:21:59 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc420181800) 2017/06/11 10:21:59 DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 200 OK Transfer-Encoding: chunked Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * Cache-Control: private Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 Date: Sun, 11 Jun 2017 09:23:09 GMT X-Openstack-Request-Id: XXXX X-Trans-Id: XXXX

Internal Error

The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation.

ahhh the container is "default"
rclone -v ls hubic:default/
